answers.author: Pooja Varma
answers.text:
Hi Colleen,
In the Washington D, C. District Response Plan, the Department of Public Works and Metropolitan Police Department coordinate in towing obstructing vehicles under the Emergency Support Functions. 
http://hsema.dc.gov/dcema/lib/dcema/drp(underrevison2007)copy.pdf
The Emergency Operations Plan of the Town of Warren, Rhode Island designates the Police Department to tow vehicles blocking routes and maintain storage records with the Public Works Department. 
http://www.townofwarren-ri.gov/images/Emergency_Operations_Plan.pdf 
Finally, the City of New Orleans Emergency Preparedness Plan also makes some towing provisions under the evacuation plan. 
http://msnbcmedia.msn.com/i/msnbc/Components/Interactives/News/US/Katrina/docs/City%20Of%20New%20Orleans%20Emergency%20Preparedness%20-%20Hurricanes.pdf 
You may want to contact the city departments directly for further information. 
I hope this is helpful,
Pooja Varma
International City/County Management Association
Knowledge Network Intern
pvarma@icma.org

author: Colleen Hendry
text: I am researching disaster preparedness from a towing perspective.  Does anyone here have towing and vehicle removal, storage and impound in their disaster preparedness plans?  If so, I would love to discuss with you.
title: Disaster Recovery - Towing Response
